title: Bug 3666CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to control the amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option.
OB: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the software eats too much code. In the given class, when adding a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method, the code assist replaces more code than necessary.
EB: The code should be changed to 'baz(x.foo().foo())'. It is expected that the code assist will provide 'baz(x.foo()x.foo())'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Change the 'baz' call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press CtrlSpace to bring up the code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()'.
6. Observe the excessive code replacement.
